title.rendered: Stevi Hillman: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Stevi Hillman
    • Early Life
    • Professional Career
    • Horses
  • Stevi Hillman’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
    • Endorsements
  • Personal Details
    • Husband
    • How Old is Stevi Hillman?
    • What is her nationality?
    • FAQs About Stevi Hillman

Stevi Hillman is a celebrated professional barrel racer and horse trainer, known for her exceptional skills and intimate connection with her horses. Born on October 29, 1986, Hillman has made a significant impact in the world of rodeo, qualifying for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) eight times as of 2023. She has consistently ranked among the top barrel racers, earning recognition and respect in the sport.

Here we have Stevi Hillman’s net worth, career earnings, professional career, achievements, relationship status, and more.

About Stevi Hillman

Stevi Hillman was born in Ordway, Colorado, and later moved to Texas in 2004 to pursue her dream of becoming a professional barrel racer.

She was named after the famous singer Stevie Nicks and grew up admiring barrel racers like Rachael Myllymaki. Hillman’s family includes her husband, Ty Hillman, and her stepfather, Dave Salzbrenner.

Early Life

Stevi Hillman’s passion for horses began at a very young age. Her parents had her on a horse before she could walk, and she spent many of her youngest years growing up around cattle and horses.

When she didn’t have a horse close at hand, Stevi would go to her neighbor’s house and get on his horse bareback, making her own makeshift bridle out of string and twine from baled hay.

Her training foundation started when her dad bought Stevi her first horse when she was only 12 years old.

Professional Career

Stevi Hillman’s professional career in barrel racing began in 2012 when she joined the Women’s Professional Rodeo Association (WPRA). 

Over the years, she has ridden many great horses, including Cuatro Fame, also known as “Truck,” and has recently had great success on the young horse Famous Lemon Drop Hillman has qualified for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) eight times as of 2023.

She has also had significant wins in various rodeos, including the Pendleton Round-up, which she won for the second time in her career, the Livingston Round-up, the Raymond Stampede, the Durant Pro Rodeo, the Owyhee County Rodeo, and the Strathmore Stampede.

In 2021, Hillman crossed the $1 million mark in career earnings at the Wrangler NFR after winning $111,892. As of the 2023 regular season, her earnings stand at $109,015 Hillman’s career is not just about winning rodeos and earning money. 

She uses her platform as a professional barrel racer to inspire young girls to work hard and pursue their dreams, even when it doesn’t seem possible.

Her dedication to the sport and her ability to inspire others make her a significant figure in the world of rodeo.

Horses

Stevi Hillman has ridden several notable horses throughout her career, each contributing to her success in the rodeo arena.

One of her most famous horses is Cuatro Fame, also known as “Truck,” a 16-year-old bay gelding as of 2023.

Truck has been a significant part of Hillman’s career, helping her to top the long round of RFD-TV’s The American in 2021.

Another notable horse in Hillman’s career was Famous Lemon Drop, a young palomino mare owned by Matt and Bendi Dunn. 

Hillman also rides RV Brijett, a 6-year-old mare, and Sand In My Socks, a 6-year-old sorrel mare.

Stevi Hillman’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, Stevi Hillman’s net worth is estimated to be $3 million.

In 2023 alone, she earned over $109,015 in the regular season.

Career Earnings

Stevi Hillman’s career earnings have been impressive, reflecting her success in the rodeo arena. As of the 2023 regular season, her earnings stand at $109,015. However, her total career earnings amount to $1,292,782.

Hillman’s earnings have steadily increased over the years. In 2012, she finished second in the WPRA Rookie of the Year and earned $2,536. By 2015, she had moved up the ranks to finish the year with $6,522. 

A significant milestone in Hillman’s career was in 2021 when she crossed the $1 million mark in career earnings at the Wrangler NFR after winning $111,892. 

This achievement placed her among the top earners in the sport of barrel racing. Hillman’s earnings are a testament to her skill, dedication, and success in the sport of barrel racing.

Hillman’s career earnings as of the 2023 regular season amount to $109,015. She made the million-dollar mark at the 2021 NFR, becoming the newest $1 million cowgirl on the rodeo trail.

Endorsements

Stevi Hillman has been endorsed by several brands, including Durango Boot and Kahm CBD, for which she is an ambassador. She is also a sponsored rider for Nutrena.

Personal Details

Husband

Stevi Hillman is married to Ty Hillman, a success coach with Prepare To Win. They use their platform to encourage others, share their faith, and God’s love wherever they can.

How Old is Stevi Hillman?

As of November 27, 2023, Stevi Hillman is 37 years old.

What is her nationality?

He is American.

FAQs About Stevi Hillman

When did Stevi Hillman start her professional career?

Stevi Hillman started her professional career in 2012 when she joined the Women’s Professional Rodeo Association (WPRA).

How many times has she qualified for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR)?

As of 2023, she has qualified for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) eight times.

Who is her husband?

She is married to Ty Hillman.
